required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Valsartan Versus Amlodipine in Postmenopausal Women With Hypertension
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Parallel Group, Active-controlled, 38-week Study to Evaluate the Efficacy of Valsartan Versus Amlodipine on the Arterial Properties of Postmenopausal Women With Mild to Moderate Hypertension

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is compare treatment with valsartan with the possible addition of a diuretic, hydrochlorothiazide, on high blood pressure with the drug amlodipine with the possible addition of a diuretic, hydrochlorothiazide. In particular, the effect of treatment on the stiffness of the blood vessels will be studied.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 38 in the Carotid-femoral Pulse Wave Velocity (PWV)
primary_outcome.description: PWV was determined from transcutaneous Doppler flow recordings and the foot-to-foot method triggered by the simultaneous ECG. Two simultaneous Doppler flow tracings were taken at the left common carotid and the right femoral artery in the groin with a linear array probe. The time delay (t) was measured between R wave of the ECG and the base of the flow waves recorded at these points, and averaged over 10 beats. The distance (D) traveled by the pulse wave was measured over body surface as the distance from the suprasternal notch to the carotid artery. PWV was calculated as PWV=D/t.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Post-ischemic Forearm Skin Reactive Hyperemia at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Cutaneous blood flow was continuously recorded by a laser Doppler flowmeter. The laser Doppler flow probe was applied on the volar part of the right forearm with a plastic holder 10 cm proximal to the wrist. All measurements were made with a pressure cuff on the arm and inflated 20 mmHg above systolic BP and maintained for 2 min then rapidly deflated. All measurements were made in a quiet room with a patient in the supine position. The maximal reactive hyperemia was measured after cuff deflation, which allows measurement of the right forearm postischemic skin reactive hyperemia (SRH).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Post-ischemic Forearm Skin Reactive Hyperemia at Endpoint (Week 38)
secondary_outcome.description: Cutaneous blood flow was continuously recorded by a laser Doppler flowmeter. The laser Doppler flow probe was applied on the volar part of the right forearm with a plastic holder 10 cm proximal to the wrist. All measurements were made with a pressure cuff on the arm and inflated 20 mmHg above systolic BP and maintained for 2 min then rapidly deflated. All measurements were made in a quiet room with a patient in the supine position. The maximal reactive hyperemia was measured after cuff deflation, which allows measurement of the right forearm postischemic skin reactive hyperemia (SRH).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline for Endothelial Function Measured by Brachial Artery Flow-mediated Vasodilatation (FMD) Using the Brachial Artery Reactivity Test (BART) at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Endothelial function will be assessed using high-resolution duplex ultrasound with wall tracking to measure FMD of the brachial artery during reactive hyperemia. FMD of the brachial artery in response to reactive hyperemia in the distal forearm (and glyceryl trinitrate as a non-endothelium dependent control) will be measured from B-mode ultrasound images using a standard 7 MHz linear array transducer and HDI 5000 system with edge detection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline for Endothelial Function Measured by Brachial Artery Flow-mediated Vasodilatation (FMD) Using the Brachial Artery Reactivity Test (BART) at End-point (Week 38)
secondary_outcome.description: Endothelial function will be assessed using high-resolution duplex ultrasound with wall tracking to measure FMD of the brachial artery during reactive hyperemia. FMD of the brachial artery in response to reactive hyperemia in the distal forearm (and glyceryl trinitrate as a non-endothelium dependent control) will be measured from B-mode ultrasound images using a standard 7 MHz linear array transducer and HDI 5000 system with edge detection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Mean Left Carotid Distensibility at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: For carotid distensibility, the left and right bulbs and common carotid arteries are measured using tissue Doppler imaging with the linear array probe. Absolute diameter and diameter changes over the cardiac cycles will be recorded. Distensibility of each bulb will be calculated for three consecutive heart cycles and averaged and corrected for blood pressure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Mean Left Carotid Distensibility at Week 38
secondary_outcome.description: For carotid distensibility, the left and right bulbs and common carotid arteries are measured using tissue Doppler imaging with the linear array probe. Absolute diameter and diameter changes over the cardiac cycles will be recorded. Distensibility of each bulb will be calculated for three consecutive heart cycles and averaged and corrected for blood pressure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Mean Right Carotid Distensibility at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: For carotid distensibility, the left and right bulbs and common carotid arteries are measured using tissue Doppler imaging with the linear array probe. Absolute diameter and diameter changes over the cardiac cycles will be recorded. Distensibility of each bulb will be calculated for three consecutive heart cycles and averaged and corrected for blood pressure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Mean Right Carotid Distensibility at Week 38
secondary_outcome.description: For carotid distensibility, the left and right bulbs and common carotid arteries are measured using tissue Doppler imaging with the linear array probe. Absolute diameter and diameter changes over the cardiac cycles will be recorded. Distensibility of each bulb will be calculated for three consecutive heart cycles and averaged and corrected for blood pressure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Baroreflex Sensitivity as it Relates to Changes in Carotid Distensibility From Baseline to Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: The calculation of spontaneous baroflex sensitivity was obtained by the sequence method. Baroflex sequences are defined by at least three consecutive beats in which the systolic blood pressure and the RR interval of the following beat either both increased or decreased. The slope of each individual sequence is computed and the mean slope is determined as the average of all slopes within a given period of time and taken as the gain of the cardiac baroflex (BRSs).

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Baroreflex Sensitivity as it Relates to Changes in Carotid Distensibility From Baseline to Week 38
secondary_outcome.description: The calculation of spontaneous baroflex sensitivity was obtained by the sequence method. Baroflex sequences are defined by at least three consecutive beats in which the systolic blood pressure and the RR interval of the following beat either both increased or decreased. The slope of each individual sequence is computed and the mean slope is determined as the average of all slopes within a given period of time and taken as the gain of the cardiac baroflex (BRSs).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Left Ventricular Mass Index (LVMI) and Diastolic Function Using Echocardiography From Baseline to Week 38
Changes in Central Blood Pressure, Evaluated by Applanation Tonometry From Baseline at Weeks 12 and 38
secondary_outcome.description: Central Blood Pressure was measured via applanation tonometry recordings of the common carotid artery and from brachial oscillometric recordings. The Simultaneously obtained carotid artery pressure and standard brachial artery blood pressure are computed to obtain the central systolic pressure.

intervention.description: Patients received 160 mg valsartan for 4 weeks. Patients were then up-titrated to receive either 320 mg valsartan for the following 8 weeks.
Patients received 5 mg amlodipine for four weeks. Patients were then up-titrated to receive 10 mg amlodipine for the following 8 weeks.

At Week 12, patients who did not meet target Blood Pressure for both Systolic Blood Pressure < 140 mmHg and Diastolic Blood Pressure < 90 mmHg were eligible to receive 12.5 mg open-label Hydrochlorothiazide for the following 26 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Postmenopausal women
- Mild to moderate hypertension
- Statin therapy or LDL≤ 4.1 mmol/L
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe hypertension
- LDL > 4.1 mmol/L if not taking anti-hyperlipidemic medication
- Certain hormonal therapy
- History of stroke, myocardial infarction, heart failure, chest pain, abnormal heart rhythm
- Liver, kidney, or pancreas disease
- Diabetes
- Raynaud's disease or any other significant peripheral vascular disease
- Allergy to certain medications used to treat high blood pressure
Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply.

group.title: Valsartan 320 mg
group.description: Double-blind study medication consisted of valsartan 160 mg capsules for oral administration. Open-label HCTZ 12.5 mg (orally administered) was electively prescribed at week 12.

group.title: Amlodipine 10 mg
group.description: Amlodipine, orally administered, was provided as 5 mg capsules. Open-label HCTZ 12.5 mg (orally administered) was electively prescribed at week 12.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Condition no longer required study drug

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Week 38 in the Carotid-femoral Pulse Wave Velocity (PWV)
outcome.description: PWV was determined from transcutaneous Doppler flow recordings and the foot-to-foot method triggered by the simultaneous ECG. Two simultaneous Doppler flow tracings were taken at the left common carotid and the right femoral artery in the groin with a linear array probe. The time delay (t) was measured between R wave of the ECG and the base of the flow waves recorded at these points, and averaged over 10 beats. The distance (D) traveled by the pulse wave was measured over body surface as the distance from the suprasternal notch to the carotid artery. PWV was calculated as PWV=D/t.
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat. The intent to treat population is defined as those who provide a baseline measure and at least one post-baseline measurement (not necessarily an endpoint measure)

outcome.title: Changes in Baroreflex Sensitivity as it Relates to Changes in Carotid Distensibility From Baseline to Week 12
outcome.description: The calculation of spontaneous baroflex sensitivity was obtained by the sequence method. Baroflex sequences are defined by at least three consecutive beats in which the systolic blood pressure and the RR interval of the following beat either both increased or decreased. The slope of each individual sequence is computed and the mean slope is determined as the average of all slopes within a given period of time and taken as the gain of the cardiac baroflex (BRSs).
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat. The intent to treat population is defined as those who provide a baseline measure and at least one post-baseline measurement (not necessarily an endpoint measure)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (i.e., data from all sites) in the clinical trial.
